financial_news.text: Apple stock surged 5% after strong quarterly earnings beat analyst expectations.
Tesla shares plummeted following disappointing delivery numbers and production concerns.
JPMorgan reports record profits driven by trading revenue amid market volatility.
Bank of America faces regulatory scrutiny over lending practices.
Federal Reserve signals potential rate hike in upcoming meeting.
Oil prices rally as OPEC announces production cuts.
Amazon announces massive layoffs affecting 10,000 employees.
Microsoft cloud revenue exceeds expectations, driving stock to all-time high.
Goldman Sachs downgrades retail sector citing consumer spending concerns.
Nvidia beats earnings estimates on strong AI chip demand.
Healthcare stocks decline amid drug pricing legislation concerns.
Meta announces new AI features, stock jumps 8% in after-hours trading.
Inflation data comes in higher than expected, markets react negatively.
Disney reports streaming subscriber growth, reversing previous declines.
Cryptocurrency market faces another selloff as regulatory concerns mount.
Boeing receives major order from United Airlines for new aircraft.
Unemployment claims fall to multi-decade low, signaling strong labor market.
Energy sector rallies on geopolitical tensions and supply concerns.
Pfizer announces promising trial results for new cancer treatment.
Ford recalls 500,000 vehicles due to safety concerns.
Google parent Alphabet announces stock buyback program.
Real estate market shows signs of cooling as mortgage rates rise.
Visa and Mastercard report strong transaction volumes.
Supply chain disruptions continue to impact manufacturing sector.
Consumer confidence index rises to highest level in six months.
Netflix loses subscribers for third consecutive quarter.
Chevron announces increased dividend following strong oil profits.
Retail sales data disappoints, raising recession fears.
Berkshire Hathaway increases stake in major tech companies.
Semiconductor shortage expected to ease in coming quarters.
